w:r.w:t: This project is designed to give students
end experience in software testing using a real EdTech or LMS application. By selecting an open-source system from GitHub (or using their own developed software), students will learn how to

requirements, design test cases, create test plans, and execute both manual and automated tests. The project covers all major areas of modern software testing, including functional testing, non-functional testing, API testing, performance testing, security testing, and accessibility evaluation.

hrough this assignment, students will not only apply theoretical concepts learned in the course but also gain hands-on skills with industry-standard tools such as Selenium, Postman, JMeter, and OWASP methodologies. The final

including documentation, automation scripts, performance reports, defect logs, and a training video—will help students build a strong professional portfolio and demonstrate their ability to test real-world applications in a structured and professional manner.
You must choose an open-source EdTech application from GitHub.
Be an LMS or EdTech tool with multiple modules.
Have enough functional and technical features to support all types of testing.
Provide installation instructions so you can run it locally.
If you cannot find a suitable open-source system, you may use software that you personally developed earlier.
What you must submit for this step:
GitHub links to the project, the version you tested, and installation screenshots.
Details of your environment (OS, browser, device used).
Create a complete Test Plan: objectives, scope, strategy, risks, environments, tools, and resources.
Use these techniques: EP, BVA, decision tables, state-transition, use-case testing.
Execute your test cases and provide evidence (screenshots/logs).
Do UI automation using Selenium or Playwright.
Do API automation using Postman or a similar tool.
Run load and stress tests using JMeter or any equivalent tool.
Report at least 10 defects with correct severity and priority.
Prepare a Test Summary Report including metrics, coverage, defect analysis, and conclusions.
training video showing your testing activities and results.
A professionally formatted DOCX document (main assignment).
All work must be your own.
No plagiarism, no copying code, no reusing old assignments.
All scripts, results, and documents must be created fresh for this assignment.
This assignment is 50% of your CA grade.
No late submissions will be accepted.
